summary: This document outlines the terms of the Butterfly Trust established by Jeffrey E. Epstein, naming Darren K. Indyke and Richard Kahn as trustees. It details the powers of the trustees, the conditions for adding beneficiaries, and the irrevocable nature of the trust. The trust is designed to manage and distribute assets to specified beneficiaries, including provisions for the trustees' discretion in managing the trust's assets.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is the creator of the Butterfly Trust and has transferred property to the trustees for management.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Darren K. Indyke is one of the trustees of the Butterfly Trust, responsible for managing the trust's assets and making distributions to beneficiaries.

events.title: Establishment of Butterfly Trust
events.description: The Butterfly Trust is established by Jeffrey E. Epstein, with Darren K. Indyke and Richard Kahn appointed as trustees.

events.title: Addition of Beneficiaries
events.description: Darren K. Indyke and Richard Kahn add Jennifer Kalin and Alina Boiko as beneficiaries of the Butterfly Trust.

events.title: Addition of Beneficiary
events.description: Darren K. Indyke and Richard Kahn add Susan Hamblin as a beneficiary of the Butterfly Trust.

keyFacts: The Butterfly Trust was established on December 27, 2006, by Jeffrey E. Epstein.
Darren K. Indyke and Richard Kahn are the appointed trustees of the Butterfly Trust.
The trust allows for the addition of beneficiaries at the discretion of the trustees during the lifetime of the grantor.
Beneficiaries named in the trust include Sarah L. Kellen, Nada Marcinkova, and Ghislaine N. Maxwell.
Jennifer Kalin, Alina Boiko, and Susan Hamblin were later added as beneficiaries.
